Class SuperPixel

  • java.lang.Object
    • SuperPixel

  • public class SuperPixel
extends java.lang.Object
    A pixel refers to a dot that makes up part of an image. A superpixel is a large-ish pixel of customizable color. A superpixel does not maintain any data regarding its location in an image, only the size of the pixel and its intended color. Images are formed by arranging superpixels into a grid and then drawing at each point a circle matching the pixel's size, in the pixel's color.
    Author:
    kentcollins
